pathAssistantSteps.info: Ensure a Disqualified reason is added.

Research and contact your new lead quickly.

Research your lead online.

  • Visit their website to learn about their business.
  • Look them up on social networks to determine how to best engage and connect.

Contact a new lead as soon as possible.

  • The sooner you contact them, the higher the likelihood of converting them to a customer. 

Verify that their contact information is correct.
Assign the lead to the appropriate Nurture campaign for future engagement.

If the lead is fully qualified, convert them to an Account, Contact and Opportunity.  


This establishes them as a legitimate prospect and separates them from general leads.

  • If the lead is not qualified, but might be someday, check the "Add to Nurture Campaign" box so our marketing team can engage them.
  • If the lead is not qualified and will never be, do nothing. These leads will be archived after a year.

Verify contact information and qualify lead.

  • If contacting via phone, follow up immediately after with a thank you email.
  • If contacting via email and they reply quickly, follow up immediately with a phone call
  • Complete the lead scoring fields to determine if they are a good prospect.
  • Rehearse your call script and qualification questions so you sound confident and the flow of your conversation is more natural.

If qualified, change the status to “Qualified”.

  • This establishes them as a legitimate prospect and separates them from general leads.
  • If this is not qualified, but might be someday, move to the the "Nurture” Status and fill in the “Nurture Reason” field so our marketing team can engage them in future campaigns. If it's not qualified and will never be, move the lead to “Unqualified” and fill in the “Unqualified Reason” field. These will be archived after a year.
